intro: Acrosanthes microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved acrosanthus, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
